story.text: Jan 2 Titanium Metals Corp. TIE.N said it sold its 43.7 percent stake in Valtimet SAS to ValTubes SAS for $75 million cash and will record a related pre-tax gain of about $39 million in the fourth quarter. In a statement, the producer of titanium metal products said it entered into a new long-term agreement with Valtimet to supply up to 2,500 metric tons of titanium strip annually for use in the manufacture of welded titanium tubing. Valtimet SAS is a manufacturing joint venture between Titanium Metals, ValTubes SAS, Sumitomo Corp. (8053.T) and Sumitomo Metal Industries 5405.T formed in 1997 for the manufacture of welded stainless steel and titanium tubing. (Reporting by Dilipp S. Nag in Bangalore)
story.title: titanium metals sells stake in valtimet jv , to record gain in q4
